required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 12 Month Open Extension of TNS for ADHD.
clinical_study.official_title: 12 Month Open Extension Study of TNS for ADHD .

brief_summary.textblock: Participants who exhibit sufficient ADHD symptom improvement in a prior study of active TNS will be invited to continue in a 12-month extension study, designed to collect additional data on long-term response and tolerability and to provide participants ongoing clinical benefit from treatment.

detailed_description.textblock:
Children, ages 8-12 years, participated in a 5 week double-blind, sham-controlled study of active Trigeminal Nerve Stimulation (TNS). Participants randomized to sham in the double-blind, were then invited into a 4-week open TNS trial. Participants who met positive response criteria to active TNS, either during the original double-blind study or the open-treatment followup, were invited to continue their TNS treatment in a 12-month open extension phase.
Participants who continued in the 12-month extension returned for study visits every 3 months to assess ongoing response and safety/tolerability data. Unless otherwise noted, baseline line assessments in the 12-month extension are taken from the final visit of the preceding active treatment trial, i.e. the visit at which positive response criteria were met.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
primary_outcome.description: A dimensional rating of ADHD symptoms, with scores ranging from 0 to 54, with higher scores signifying worse severity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Categorical measure indicating degree improved or not improved compared with global functioning at baseline in the preceding double-blind trial. The base CGI-I scale is a 7-point measure that requires the investigator to assess how much the condition has improved or worsened compared to baseline prior to initiation of treatment. Ratings are (1) very much improved; (2) much improved; (3) minimally improved; (4) no change; (5) minimally worse; (6) much worse; (7) very much worse. For purposes of analysis, the measure is dichotomized such that scores <= 2 signify "improved" and scores > 2 signify "not improved."

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: A dimensional measure assessed in cm.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: A dimensional measure assessed in kg.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: A dimensional measure assessed in mm Hg.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: A dimensional measure assessed in mm Hg.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: A dimensional measure assessed in heart beats per minute.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
other_outcome.description: Parent completed dimensional rating of ADHD symptoms, with scores ranging from 0-30, and higher scores signifying more severe symptoms.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
other_outcome.description: Teacher completed dimensional rating of ADHD symptoms, with scores ranging from 0-30, and higher scores indicating more severe symptoms.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
other_outcome.description: A child completed dimensional measure of emotional reactivity, with scores ranging from 0-12, and higher scores indicating greater severity.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
other_outcome.description: A parent completed dimensional measure of emotional reactivity, with scores ranging from 0-12, and higher scores indicating greater severity.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
other_outcome.description: A parent completed 33-item scale to assess sleep related problems. Total scores range from 33 to 99, divided among 8 sub scales, with higher scores indicating more severe difficulties.

other_outcome.measure: Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children (MASC) Child Report
other_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
other_outcome.description: A child completed rating of child anxiety, with scores ranging from 0-300, and higher scores indicating greater severity.

other_outcome.measure: Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children (MASC) Parent Report
other_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
other_outcome.description: A parent completed measure of child anxiety, with scores ranging fro 0-300, and higher scores indicating greater severity.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
other_outcome.description: A clinician completed dimensional measure of child mood symptoms, obtained from parent and child interview, with range of scores from 17 to 113, and higher scores indicating more severe depression. A score >= 40 suggests depression; scores <=28 define remission.

other_outcome.measure: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Functioning (BRIEF)
other_outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12
other_outcome.description: A parent completed rating of executive functioning. Comprises 5 sub scales that measure various measures of behavior and cognition. Raw scores for each measure are converted to T scores ranging from 28 to 103, with higher scores indicating greater difficulties.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive trigeminal nerve stimulation (TNS) administered by the Monarch eTNS System nightly during sleep for up to 12 months of this open-extension trial.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male and female children ages 8-13 with DSM-5 ADHD, and current presentation, as determined by KSADS and clinical interview
- received active TNS therapy in a previous trial and demonstrated a CGI-I score <= 2.
- parents able and willing to monitor proper use of the TNS device and complete all required rating scales
- parent and participants able to compete study rating scales and other measures in English
Exclusion Criteria:
- none

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impression - Improvement (CGI-I)
outcome.description: Categorical measure indicating degree improved or not improved compared with global functioning at baseline in the preceding double-blind trial. The base CGI-I scale is a 7-point measure that requires the investigator to assess how much the condition has improved or worsened compared to baseline prior to initiation of treatment. Ratings are (1) very much improved; (2) much improved; (3) minimally improved; (4) no change; (5) minimally worse; (6) much worse; (7) very much worse. For purposes of analysis, the measure is dichotomized such that scores <= 2 signify "improved" and scores > 2 signify "not improved."

outcome.population: Some participants lost to follow up over time.

outcome.title: Conners Global Index - Parent Report
outcome.description: Parent completed dimensional rating of ADHD symptoms, with scores ranging from 0-30, and higher scores signifying more severe symptoms.

outcome.title: Conner Global Index - Teacher Report
outcome.description: Teacher completed dimensional rating of ADHD symptoms, with scores ranging from 0-30, and higher scores indicating more severe symptoms.
outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12

outcome.title: Affective Reactivity Index (ARI-C) Child
outcome.description: A child completed dimensional measure of emotional reactivity, with scores ranging from 0-12, and higher scores indicating greater severity.
outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12

outcome.title: Affective Reactivity Index (ARI-P) Parent
outcome.description: A parent completed dimensional measure of emotional reactivity, with scores ranging from 0-12, and higher scores indicating greater severity.
outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12

outcome.title: Children's Sleep Habits Questionnaire (CSHQ)
outcome.description: A parent completed 33-item scale to assess sleep related problems. Total scores range from 33 to 99, divided among 8 sub scales, with higher scores indicating more severe difficulties.
outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12

outcome.title: Children's Depression Rating Scale - Revised (CDRS-R)
outcome.description: A clinician completed dimensional measure of child mood symptoms, obtained from parent and child interview, with range of scores from 17 to 113, and higher scores indicating more severe depression. A score >= 40 suggests depression; scores <=28 define remission.
outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12

outcome.title: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Functioning (BRIEF)
outcome.description: A parent completed rating of executive functioning. Comprises 5 sub scales that measure various measures of behavior and cognition. Raw scores for each measure are converted to T scores ranging from 28 to 103, with higher scores indicating greater difficulties.
outcome.time_frame: Change over baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12

reported_events.desc: Adverse events were solicited via a structured side effects questionnaire and open inquiry, completed at each study visit.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
